history.content: Would recommend just leaving off that 186/168/EE16A and keeping 170, 61C, and an easy breadth which is more manageable given you want to focus on recruiting in the fall. 170 has weekly problem sets that take on average 20+ hrs/week and 61C is a project heavy course so expect to be spending a lot of time debugging. If you find yourself with extra time go ahead and put it into grinding out leetcode or polishing a personal project. Once you secure an internship, you can always take more classes in Spring semester if anything. In terms of useful classes for recruiting, you should look into taking 162 in the future as concurrency is often an interview question.

Would recommend just leaving off that 186/168/EE16A and keeping 170, 61C, and an easy breadth which is more manageable given you want to focus on recruiting in the fall. 170 has weekly problem sets that take on average 20+ hrs/week and 61C is a project heavy course so expect to be spending a lot of time debugging. If you find yourself with extra time go ahead and put it into grinding out leetcode or polishing a personal project. Once you secure an internship, you can always take more classes in Spring semester if anything. In terms of useful classes for recruiting, you should look into taking 162 in the future as concurrency is often an interview question or 168 (only Fall) because some companies look for solid TCP knowledge.

Would recommend just leaving off that 186/168/EE16A and keeping 170, 61C, and an easy breadth which is more manageable given you want to focus on recruiting in the fall. 170 has weekly problem sets that take on average 20+ hrs/week and 61C is a project heavy course so expect to be spending a lot of time debugging. If you find yourself with extra time go ahead and put it into grinding out leetcode or polishing a personal project. Once you secure an internship, you can always take more classes in Spring semester if anything.

I'm planning on taking 170, 61C, an easy breadth, and either 186/168/EE16A. 

Considering recruiting in the fall, which additional class is most feasible (workload wise) to add on? Also, which class is most useful for recruiting or in general recommended to take earlier?
history.subject: 170 + 61C + breadth + ??
